query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 Noi demmo il dosso al misero vallone 8 su per la ripa che ’l cinge dintorno, 9 attraversando sanza alcun sermone.
query.result:
**English:**
7 We turned our backs on the wretched valley 8 and climbed the bank that encircles it all around, 9 crossing over without speaking a word.
**Cornish:**
7 Ni a roas an keth dhe’n glyn truan 8 warbarth an keth war an menydh a’y kewyn, 9 ow tremena heb kewsel ger.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Quiv’ era men che notte e men che giorno, 11 sì che ’l viso m’andava innanzi poco; 12 ma io senti’ sonare un alto corno,
13 tanto ch’avrebbe ogne tuon fatto fioco, 14 che, contra sé la sua via seguitando, 15 dirizzò li occhi miei tutti ad un loco.
query.result:
**English:**
10 Here it was less than night and less than day, 11 so that my sight could see but a little way ahead; 12 but I heard a loud horn sounding,
13 so loud that it would have drowned out any thunder, 14 and, following its path against itself, 15 it directed my eyes all to one place.
**Cornish:**
10 Ama o le nag nos na nag dydh, 11 marow vyth vyth golwg a veu byghan a-rag, 12 mes vy a glewas karn uhel ow sonna,
13 marow uhel henna a veu pub ton ow tos tew, 14 ow hemma, ow sewya y hons orth y honan, 15 a leveris vyth golwg oll dhe unn le.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 Dopo la dolorosa rotta, quando 17 Carlo Magno perdé la santa gesta, 18 non sonò sì terribilmente Orlando.
query.result:
**English:**
16 After the disastrous rout, when 17 Charlemagne lost his holy army, 18 Orlando did not sound his horn so terribly.
**Cornish:**
16 Wosa an golledh dolorus, pythegows 17 Karl an Meur a gollas an jesta sans, 18 Rolant na sonnas y gern marow uhel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 Poco portäi in là volta la testa, 20 che me parve veder molte alte torri; 21 ond’ io: «Maestro, dì, che terra è questa?».
query.result:
**English:**
19 I had turned my head that way for a short while, 20 when it seemed to me that I saw many high towers; 21 whereupon I said: “Master, tell me, what land is this?”.
**Cornish:**
19 Byghan a dheuth vyth bena dhe’n keth, 20 pythegows vy a welas lies tor uhel; 21 rag henna vy a leveris: “Mester, lever vy, pyth tir yw henna?”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Ed elli a me: «Però che tu trascorri 23 per le tenebre troppo da la lungi, 24 avvien che poi nel maginare abborri.
query.result:
**English:**
22 And he to me: “Because you wander 23 too far through the darkness, 24 it happens that afterwards you are mistaken in your imaginings.
**Cornish:**
22 Hag hemma dhe’n keth: “Rag henna ty a dremena 23 dre’n tewlder pub pell, 24 yw ow tos wosa henna ty a wraga yn dy golwg.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Tu vedrai ben, se tu là ti congiungi, 26 quanto ’l senso s’inganna di lontano; 27 però alquanto più te stesso pungi».
query.result:
**English:**
25 You will see well, if you join me there, 26 how much the senses are deceived from afar; 27 therefore, spur yourself on a little more.
**Cornish:**
25 Ty a welo byth, ge th’aga y’n keverel, 26 pyth yw an poes sensys ow tos yn bell; 27 rag, pungi dy hunan moy bythkerrys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 Poi caramente mi prese per mano 29 e disse: «Pria che noi siam più avanti, 30 acciò che ’l fatto men ti paia strano,
31 sappi che non son torri, ma giganti, 32 e son nel pozzo intorno da la ripa 33 da l’umbilico in giuso tutti quanti».
query.result:
**English:**
28 Then he took me gently by the hand 29 and said: “Before we go any further, 30 so that the fact may seem less strange to you,
31 know that those are not towers, but giants, 32 and they are all around the well, from the edge 33 down to their navels.”
**Cornish:**
28 Wosa henna, ev a’m kemeras ow lagasow, 29 ha leverel: “Myns na vydh ni moy bella, 30 rag, dhe dhiskwedhes an gwir dhe’th eghen,
31 godhvos na’nns yw tursow, mes ughesi, 32 ha’nns ow tosow a-dro dhe’n pols a-dro dhe’n glann 33 a’ga navelow bys dhe’n chi.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 Come quando la nebbia si dissipa, 35 lo sguardo a poco a poco raffigura 36 ciò che cela ’l vapor che l’aere stipa,
37 così forando l’aura grossa e scura, 38 più e più appressando ver’ la sponda, 39 fuggiemi errore e cresciemi paura;
40 però che, come su la cerchia tonda 41 Montereggion di torri si corona, 42 così la proda che ’l pozzo circonda
43 torreggiavan di mezza la persona 44 li orribili giganti, cui minaccia 45 Giove del cielo ancora quando tuona.
query.result:
**English:**
34 As when the fog dissipates, 35 the gaze little by little makes out 36 what the vapor that thickens the air conceals,
37 so, piercing the thick and murky air, 38 drawing nearer and nearer to the edge, 39 error fled from me and fear grew;
40 because, just as on the round rampart 41 of Montereggione a crown of towers stands, 42 so the edge that encircles the well
43 was towered by the horrible giants up to their middles, 44 whom Jove still threatens from the sky when he thunders.
**Cornish:**
34 Dell yw pan voos an kov a dhiskwedh, 35 an golwg a wra dhe bys dhe bys ow tosow a-gledh 36 an peth a wra’n ayr ow stypa,
37 dell yw, ow treudhi an ayr tewl ha tewl, 38 moy ha moy ow tosow dhe’n glann, 39 an gwrians a dhiskwedhas dhym ha’m poos a greskas;
40 rag, dell yw war an kelgh termyn 41 Montereggion a goronas gans tursow, 42 dell yw an glann a wra’n pols ow kelghi
43 a wra torys gans an ughesi bys dhe’n kres, 44 an ughesi erel a wra Jow a’n nef ow tishemons 45 pan voos ev ow kerensa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 E io scorgeva già d’alcun la faccia, 47 le spalle e ’l petto e del ventre gran parte, 48 e per le coste giù ambo le braccia.
query.result:
**English:**
46 And I could already make out the face of one, 47 his shoulders and chest and a large part of his belly, 48 and both his arms down along his sides.
**Cornish:**
46 Ha my a welas ow bys anedha’y golwg, 47 y gevelyn ha’y brust ha rann vrassa a’y voos, 48 ha war y kylghyow bys dhe’n nessa y dhewlagas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Natura certo, quando lasciò l’arte 50 di sì fatti animali, assai fé bene 51 per tòrre tali essecutori a Marte.
query.result:
**English:**
49 Nature certainly, when she abandoned the art 50 of making such creatures, did very well 51 to take such executioners away from Mars.
**Cornish:**
49 An Norvys, sur, pan wosa hi ow kelli 50 an arghans avel henna, hi a wrug yn ta 51 rag kemerel henna soort avel Mars.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 La faccia sua mi parea lunga e grossa 59 come la pina di San Pietro a Roma, 60 e a sua proporzione eran l’altre ossa;
61 sì che la ripa, ch’era perizoma 62 dal mezzo in giù, ne mostrava ben tanto 63 di sovra, che di giugnere a la chioma
64 tre Frison s’averien dato mal vanto; 65 però ch’i’ ne vedea trenta gran palmi 66 dal loco in giù dov’ omo affibbia ’l manto.
query.result:
**English:**
58 His face seemed to me long and large, 59 like the pine cone of Saint Peter's in Rome, 60 and his other bones were in proportion;
61 so that the bank, which was like a loincloth 62 from the waist down, showed us clearly 63 so much of him above that three Frisians
64 would have boasted in vain that they could reach his hair; 65 for I could see thirty great spans 66 from the place where a man buckles his cloak down to his feet.
**Cornish:**
58 Yth ehen avellas ow lungo ha bras 59 avel an pina Sen Peder yn Rom, 60 ha y eghen proporsiones o eskern aral;
61 hemma an garth, o avellas perisom 62 a-dhia an kres, a dhiskwedhas ow dha 63 a-ugh, hemma tre Frison a wra
64 ow re beutrygas ow kovs ow bos; 65 rag ow a welas tregens palmi meur 66 a-dhia an le a-ugh den a wra y'n amant.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 «Raphèl maì amècche zabì almi», 68 cominciò a gridar la fiera bocca, 69 cui non si convenia più dolci salmi.
query.result:
**English:**
67 "Raphèl maì amècche zabì almi", 68 began to cry the fierce mouth, 69 to which sweeter psalms were not appropriate.
**Cornish:**
67 "Raphèl maì amècche zabì almi", 68 a dhalleth an best gwyls dhegrysi, 69 dheth na wra salmow melyes dhe les.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 E ’l duca mio ver’ lui: «Anima sciocca, 71 tienti col corno, e con quel ti disfoga 72 quand’ ira o altra passïon ti tocca!
73 Cércati al collo, e troverai la soga 74 che ’l tien legato, o anima confusa, 75 e vedi lui che ’l gran petto ti doga».
query.result:
**English:**
70 And my leader said to him: "O foolish soul, 71 hold yourself with your horn, and with that vent 72 your anger or any other passion that touches you!
73 Search your neck, and you will find the rope 74 that binds you, O confused soul, 75 and see him who pierces your great chest".
**Cornish:**
70 Ha'm duga vy dheth: "Eneval fol, 71 dal dhe'th horn, ha gans dheth disfoga 72 pan wra gorra po passion aral dhe vos toca!
73 Kergh dhe'th kodha, ha'th kavos an soga 74 o wra dhe'th kehevel, o eneval konfus, 75 ha gweles eñ o wra dhe'th doga an vra brys meur".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 Poi disse a me: «Elli stessi s’accusa; 77 questi è Nembrotto per lo cui mal coto 78 pur un linguaggio nel mondo non s’usa.
query.result:
**English:**
76 Then he said to me: "He accuses himself; 77 this is Nimrod, because of whose evil plan 78 only one language is not used in the world.
**Cornish:**
76 Wosa dheth dhe vy: "Eñ eth hunan a akusa; 77 henna yw Nembroth, rag y drok goth eñ 78 pur un yeth yn an bys na wra usys".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 Lasciànlo stare e non parliamo a vòto; 80 ché così è a lui ciascun linguaggio 81 come ’l suo ad altrui, ch’a nullo è noto».
query.result:
**English:**
79 Let us leave him and not speak in vain; 80 for every language is to him 81 as his own is to others, since none is known to him".
**Cornish:**
79 Gadevomp dhe dhe sevel, ha na gomersomp yn van; 80 rag hemma yw dheth pub yeth 81 avel y eth dhe aral, rag dhe neb yw gowsys".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 Facemmo adunque più lungo vïaggio, 83 vòlti a sinistra; e al trar d’un balestro 84 trovammo l’altro assai più fero e maggio.
query.result:
**English:**
82 So we made a longer journey, 83 turning to the left; and at a crossbow's shot 84 we found the other, much more fierce and large.
**Cornish:**
82 Merwel a wrugomp moyha viaj hirra, 83 troys dhe'n klew; ha dhe'n tenna balestra 84 ny kavos aral moyha fer ha moyha meur.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 A cigner lui qual che fosse ’l maestro, 86 non so io dir, ma el tenea soccinto 87 dinanzi l’altro e dietro il braccio destro
88 d’una catena che ’l tenea avvinto 89 dal collo in giù, sì che ’n su lo scoperto 90 si ravvolgëa infino al giro quinto.
query.result:
**English:**
85 Who was his master, I cannot say, 86 but he held him bound 87 in front with the other's left arm and behind with his right,
88 with a chain that held him bound 89 from the neck down, so that it wound itself 90 up to the fifth coil on his exposed body.
**Cornish:**
85 Pwy o avellas o avellas y'n mester, 86 vy na'n gowsaf, mes eñ a wra y'n kehevel 87 a-rag dhe'n aral dhe glew klew ha dhe vregh dhe dhe dhewy.
88 Gans chayn o a wra y'n kehevel 89 a-dhia y'n kodha dhe-ves, hemma dhe wra y'n emdrogh 90 bys dhe'n pympes droy war y'n korf diskudhys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 «Questo superbo volle esser esperto 92 di sua potenza contra ’l sommo Giove», 93 disse ’l mio duca, «ond’ elli ha cotal merto.
query.result:
**English:**
91 "This proud one wanted to test 92 his power against the supreme Jove", 93 said my leader, "and that is why he has such a reward.
**Cornish:**
91 "An superbus-ma henna a vynnas provy 92 y'n gallos dhe'n sommo Giove", 93 a leveris vy duga, "ond elli a wra henna merth".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 Fïalte ha nome, e fece le gran prove 95 quando i giganti fer paura a’ dèi; 96 le braccia ch’el menò, già mai non move».
query.result:
**English:**
94 His name is Fialte, and he made the great attempts 95 when the giants frightened the gods; 96 the arms that he wielded, he never moves again".
**Cornish:**
94 Fialte yw y hanow, ha eñ a wrug an provow meur 95 pan wra an gigantis ow aga an dewow; 96 an bregh a wra eñ ow tennal, eñ na wra y'n movy byth".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 E io a lui: «S’esser puote, io vorrei 98 che de lo smisurato Brïareo 99 esperïenza avesser li occhi mei».
query.result:
**English:**
97 And I said to him: "If it is possible, I would like 98 to have my eyes experience the immense Briareus".
**Cornish:**
97 Ha vy dheth: "S'esser pu, vy a vynnas 98 dhe'n Brïareo smisurat 99 ow kavos vy'm lagha y'm dewlyn".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 Ond’ ei rispuose: «Tu vedrai Anteo 101 presso di qui che parla ed è disciolto, 102 che ne porrà nel fondo d’ogne reo.
query.result:
**English:**
100 And he replied: "You will see Antaeus 101 near here, who speaks and is unbound, 102 who will place us at the bottom of every evil."
**Cornish:**
100 Ha henna a leveris: "Ti a welo Anteo 101 ogas ow, ow a wra ha bos ha diskwedhys, 102 hag a wra ni dhegas oll an drwg."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 Quel che tu vuo’ veder, più là è molto 104 ed è legato e fatto come questo, 105 salvo che più feroce par nel volto».
query.result:
**English:**
103 What you want to see is much farther on, 104 and is bound and made like this one, 105 except that he seems more fierce in his face."
**Cornish:**
103 An tra a vynsi gweles, pella yw moy 104 ha ev a wra kevys ha gwres hagena, 105 mes moyhagas yw moyhagas yn y rudh."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 Non fu tremoto già tanto rubesto, 107 che scotesse una torre così forte, 108 come Fïalte a scuotersi fu presto.
query.result:
**English:**
106 There was never an earthquake so violent 107 that shook a tower so strongly, 108 as Fialte was quick to shake himself.
**Cornish:**
106 Nyns o jammay kryjyans ken kreffa, 107 ow a skwydhas tour ken kreffa, 108 dell Fialte a skwydhas y honan yn bys."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 Allor temett’ io più che mai la morte, 110 e non v’era mestier più che la dotta, 111 s’io non avessi viste le ritorte.
query.result:
**English:**
109 Then I feared death more than ever, 110 and there was no need for more than fear, 111 if I had not seen the bonds.
**Cornish:**
109 An lavarna vy dhe bys moy es, 110 ha nyns esa moy es ages an dowtons, 111 mar nyns esa gweles an kethow."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 Noi procedemmo più avante allotta, 113 e venimmo ad Anteo, che ben cinque alle, 114 sanza la testa, uscia fuor de la grotta.
query.result:
**English:**
112 We proceeded much farther, 113 and we came to Antaeus, who, without his head, 114 stood out of the cave for a good five ells.
**Cornish:**
112 Ni a junyas moy pella, 113 ha ni a dheuth dhe Anteo, pymp ellyn, 114 heb y ben, a veu dhe-ves an ogof."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 «O tu che ne la fortunata valle 116 che fece Scipïon di gloria reda, 117 quand’ Anibàl co’ suoi diede le spalle,
118 recasti già mille leon per preda, 119 e che, se fossi stato a l’alta guerra 120 de’ tuoi fratelli, ancor par che si creda
121 ch’avrebber vinto i figli de la terra: 122 mettine giù, e non ten vegna schifo, 123 dove Cocito la freddura serra.
query.result:
**English:**
115 "O you who in the fortunate valley 116 that made Scipio heir to glory, 117 when Hannibal and his men turned their backs,
118 once brought down a thousand lions as prey, 119 and who, if you had been at the great war 120 of your brothers, it still seems to be believed
121 that the sons of Earth would have won: 122 put us down, and do not be disgusted by it, 123 where Cocytus locks up the cold.
**Cornish:**
115 "O ti yn an glyn forthus 116 a wrug Scipio ha bos rudh, 117 pan wrug Hannibal ha'y dus,
118 ti a laddas mil leon avel, 119 ha mar tussa yn an vresel uhel 120 a'th froer, mar a grysir,
121 bos a veu an mebyon an Norvys: 122 lak ni dhe-ves, ha na wra gonn dhiso, 123 le may Cocytus an yeniver."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 Non ci fare ire a Tizio né a Tifo: 125 questi può dar di quel che qui si brama; 126 però ti china e non torcer lo grifo.
query.result:
**English:**
124 Do not make us go to Tityus or Typhon: 125 this one can give what is desired here; 126 therefore, bend down and do not turn up your nose.
**Cornish:**
124 Na wra ni dhe-ves dhe Dizio po Tifo: 125 henna a all dalleth an tra a hwil, 126 rag wra'th onan ha na wra'th on dro.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 Ancor ti può nel mondo render fama, 128 ch’el vive, e lunga vita ancor aspetta 129 se ’nnanzi tempo grazia a sé nol chiama».
query.result:
**English:**
127 He can still give you fame in the world, 128 for he is alive and still expects a long life, 129 if grace does not call him to itself before his time."
**Cornish:**
127 Yth all dalleth bos hanow yn an bys, 128 rag ev a vew ha hir yw y vewnans, 129 mar nyns yw gras avel y galwas."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 Così disse ’l maestro; e quelli in fretta 131 le man distese, e prese ’l duca mio, 132 ond’ Ercule sentì già grande stretta.
query.result:
**English:**
130 Thus spoke the master; and he in haste 131 stretched out his hands and seized my leader, 132 so that Hercules once felt a great squeeze.
**Cornish:**
130 Henna a leveris an mester; ha henna yn bys 131 a estynnas y dhew ha a gemeras an duga'm, 132 rag Ercules a devas meur stardh."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 Virgilio, quando prender si sentio, 134 disse a me: «Fatti qua, sì ch’io ti prenda»; 135 poi fece sì ch’un fascio era elli e io.
query.result:
**English:**
133 Virgil, when he felt himself seized, 134 said to me: "Come here, so that I may take you"; 135 then he made it so that he and I were one bundle.
**Cornish:**
133 Virgilio, pan devas y honan kevys, 134 a leveris dhym: "Dos ow, rag y'm galwaf"; 135 wosa henna a wrug ni ha henna onan."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
136 Qual pare a riguardar la Carisenda 137 sotto ’l chinato, quando un nuvol vada 138 sovr’ essa sì, ched ella incontro penda:
139 tal parve Antëo a me che stava a bada 140 di vederlo chinare, e fu tal ora 141 ch’i’ avrei voluto ir per altra strada.
query.result:
**English:**
136 As seems the Carisenda to look 137 beneath its leaning side, when a cloud passes 138 over it so that it hangs opposite:
139 such Antaeus seemed to me, as I watched 140 to see him stoop, and there was a time 141 when I would have wished to go by another road.
**Cornish:**
136 Dell yw gweles an Carisenda 137 a-woles y’n pen, pan vo unn gwregh 138 owth anedhi, mar pleg dhe-ves:
139 Dell o Antaeus dhe-ves dhym, pan o-ves 140 ow gul ow weles ow plegi, ha’gan eur 141 pan vo carys ow tos ow tos ow tos.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
142 Ma lievemente al fondo che divora 143 Lucifero con Giuda, ci sposò; 144 né, sì chinato, lì fece dimora,
145 e come albero in nave si levò.
query.result:
**English:**
142 But gently at the bottom that devours 143 Lucifer with Judas, he settled us; 144 nor, so bowed down, did he make his dwelling there,
145 and like a mast in a ship he rose up.
**Cornish:**
142 Mes yn es, warbarth an fordh a wra 143 Lucifer ha Judas, ev a spousa; 144 na, keffrys, ena a wrug anedha,
145 havel marh yn les, ena a sevelsa.
